intro: Hieracium chrysophthalmum, commonly known as the golden-eyed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its bright yellow flowers, which resemble small suns, bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium chrysophthalmum is often found in temperate regions and can be an indicator plant for certain soil types.
